turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Is it loaded?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It's loaded.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Your resume is impressive. Nine years in the Army. Extensive counter terrorism work. I shouldn't be able to afford you in my current state. What's the catch?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I drink.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: How does it affect you?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: My coordination. Reaction time. If top professionals try to kidnap your daughter, the service will be on par with the pay.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: And what if amateurs try it?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'll probably kill them. Is that likely?

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: No. And no one is to know of your drinking problem. That includes my wife.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: When did Mexican Customs start getting smart?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Creasy??? Where the fuck are you?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: What do you mean, I'm here?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'm in a Customs holding tank in Mexico City International. Bring a bunch of cash... about 5K. I'm going to need it.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: You got a secondary search and you had a gun.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Listen it was a calculated risk. I've done it a million times and never got caught.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Everything happens once if you live long enough.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It doesn't make sense to x-ray your bags coming off the plane.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: This is Mexico, they do everything backwards.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: So what's wrong?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Nothing wrong.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Don't give me that bullshit.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: So how's business?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Japanese are here in a big way. Cheap labor. Factory space. But they feel a lot safer living over the border in El Paso. I ferry 'em back and forth. They think I'm John-fucking- Wayne.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: But don't you stay in El Paso?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Fuck, I love Mexico. I live like a king down here.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Yeah, right...

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Oh, like you haven't been in worse places.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: And a level five shithole is better than a level six. Your logic's inescapable.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: You been working?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Not for eight months. I was in Columbia looking around, but, nothing seemed interesting.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: How long you staying, Crease?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Got no plans, Rayburn, Nothing on. Just wanted to see you, how you were. Came by on impulse.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: You did something on impulse?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Everything happens once if you live long enough.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Your Spanish is good enough. You certainly look the part.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You're crazy. People would hire a has-been, Ray? A drunk?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Well, you'd have to keep it under control.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: And what if, just say, there was a kidnap attempt?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: You do your best. They won't be paying you enough to perform miracles.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: It's not exactly a scam, Crease. Even at half speed you're pretty damn good.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: A bodyguard has to be close to someone all the time. Willing to talk. I'm not good at that.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: So you'll be the silent type. People will appreciate that.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I came to visit you.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Bullshit. I've known you fifteen years. You don't visit.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: A bodyguard... Who's the guy?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Samuel Ramos. Owns one of the plants in Juarez. The Jap car industry is in the toilet. He's trying to persuade Ford to partner with him. I think he's in trouble. He asked me if I knew anyone he could trust.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Oh, now you think I can be trusted.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Take a job, Creasy. Breathe some air. Then decide if you want to... stick around or not.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: There's still ink on my fingers from last week.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: You got tossed. Don't trust the cops, especially the Judicials.  Oh you know that?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: You mean a misfire?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I mean nothing. The hammer came down and nothing happened. Dimple on the primer.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: I've heard of it. Never happened to me though. Maybe the firing pin's off.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Maybe...

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Sorry I woke you, Ray.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Then one day, he calls and says, 'I'm in love and I'm moving to Mexico.' I said what happened to the plan?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: I said the plan was right here.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: You got three of the fuckers. All dead.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Pinta...

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Two days gone. They're negotiating a ransom.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Stomach's gone. But... okay.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: I'll get you up to the border. Friend of mine'll take you in to San Diego. Drop you right at the hospital.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Fuck. Look at you; you won't last a day the shape you're in. Unless you stop bleeding you should have your spleen removed.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Yes or no?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: I won't kill again. Hunt people. I gave that up. Anything else? It's yours.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'll take the .45 and the Webley .32.

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: I know it's old fashioned, but it's reliable. Like us.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Cut the stock here. The barrel here. Make sure you file it smooth.  Rocket launchers?

turns.speaker: RAYBURN
turns.text: Different door. Not far from here.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Do you like dogs, Mr. Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: If they like me.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Frank doesn't take to most people. Do you speak German?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Ein Klines Bisschen. [A tiny bit.]

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Frank only responds to commands in German. He was trained in Frankfurt. My Dad loves the idea of having a dog around, but hates the fact he lives inside.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: That's 'Bird.' Emilio forgot to take him with when he left.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Who's Emilio?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: My last bodyguard. He drove me to school in the morning and picked me up in the afternoon.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: In between you can take Mom shopping and to lunch. Does that sound alright, Mr. Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Creasy. Just call me Creasy.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Creasy...

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Where are you from, Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: The United States.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I know. But which state?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You can drive and talk at the same time, can't you?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'm looking for potential.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Potential? I don't understand.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Places where the road bends, places away from buildings, places where the traffic thins out. But you don't have to understand. I do. So no talking.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Are you going to quit? My last bodyguard quit.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Let me guess, you wouldn't stop talking?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Someone gave him more money than we could.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'm a bargain.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Being black, is that a positive or negative for a bodyguard in Mexico?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Time will tell.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: There were 24 kidnappings in Mexico City in the last six days. Four a day. What do you think about that, Mr. Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Pretty impressive. Maybe I need to up my fee or get a larger gun.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: We're taking a different way home.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Did you like school, Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Not at all?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: But why not?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Hmmm?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It wasn't a school like yours and there was no Sister Anna.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: So you were unhappy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Being unhappy is a state of mind. I never thought about it.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: And don't start crying.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I'm not crying.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Pinta, do you have a pencil?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I go to school, don't I?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You're fast.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Once I get in the water but not starting off. By the time I catch up, it's too late.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Calling for Emilio's macaw. I thought I heard him.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Do you think he'll come back?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Maybe. Did you hear him?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: How do you think he got out?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Well, I let him go.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: It's better to be free, right?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Yes. Actually, he was driving me crazy.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: They'll be back in a week.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: They can stay for two weeks. I don't care.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: It hurts.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Everywhere!

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I don't think they're broken. Anywhere else?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: My ankle.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: The night you arrived, Mom asked you if you had a family and you lied, didn't you?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: White lie. I didn't have a family. But I did have two kids. They're adults now.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Do you always sleep with him?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I'm too old for him. Don't tell my friends.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I don't talk to them much. Does he have a name?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Did you sleep alright?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: How's the ankle? Can you put your weight on it?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: It's not too bad. Will it take a long time before it's better? Our big swim meet is in three weeks. Interschools. I was going to swim in the one hundred meter freestyle.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: In a week you should be fine.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Doesn't matter. I always finish second.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You need to practice.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Why do you ask?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: It was in a book at school. Concubine.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Well, it's a sort of wife.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: But the Emperor of China had 1000 of them! How can that be?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: In the West, it's one wife for one husband, but different cultures have different rules.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: It must be difficult having lots of wives.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You feel sorry for the husband?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: [Yeah. Can you imagine my mother multiplied by a thousand?]

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: So how come you know so much about those countries?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I had to do my homework on them when I worked there. Also I enjoy history.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: What did you do in Asia? Is that where you met the man with cigarettes?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No, that was in Columbia.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You don't flinch when a gun goes off; you react. You go. Don't listen for the sound; don't anticipate it. Concentrate on the sound itself.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Don't worry. You will.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Remember you asked me what state I was from?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Where you're from isn't so much about geography; it's about events. Where you're from is what happened to you.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Good things happen, too, Creasy.  Like meeting me.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I guess that really does make me a hard case.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Do you have a girlfriend, Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Did you used to?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Yeah. Two or three.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You were never late before, I was worried.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Where's my mother?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I dropped her at home.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: It's no wonder you're late. Why didn't she just come with you?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I'm not afraid you, Creasy.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I know you're not.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Are you afraid of me?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: The gunshot holds no fear. Say it.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: The gunshot holds no fear.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You welcome the sound. The sound is what lets you go. The sound is what frees you. You are a prisoner in those blocks until you hear the sound.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I'm tough, Creasy. I'm tough as you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: There's no such thing as tough. You're either trained or untrained.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: What's so important in Los Angeles?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Your father has business.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Why today? And why'd she have to go with him?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: The blocks.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I'm a prisoner in them. Until the gunshot sets me free.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Could I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Could I stop you?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You don't drink like you used to.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: That's not a question.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I know because I go in your room and check the bottles.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Still not a question.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: My mom drinks, too... Why do people drink, Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Now that's a question. I don't know about your Mom. For me, the problem isn't in the glass. The problem's in between my ears.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You think too much?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Yeah. Because at one time, I didn't think enough.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Pinta, we've got to go. Travel sucks at this time.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Frank. Frankie.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: That's strange. Frank was a no-show. Not like him to miss a ride.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You should break all my fingers, Creasy, then tape them back together. I won't be able to play the piano, but I could still swim.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Don't be a baby. You're tougher than that.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: There's no such thing as tough, Creasy. Just trained and untrained.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Then be trained.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I'm going to keep people safe someday. Just like you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Be a swimmer.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I could do it. Remember the day you wanted the pencil? I know why. And I saw that car again. I wrote the license number in my notebook. Except I missed the last number.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Continue to play in the wrong key, like you're dyslexic.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Dyslexic?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Like St. Jude. A hopeless case that has a complete block about 'C' Minor. But remember, "Whoever resists authority will bring judgement upon themselves." New Testament, Romans 13.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You got that right.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You'll be back in the water in twenty- four hours.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: The world of our children. How dare they?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It's war. The weakest suffer the most.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You're American.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: So are you.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You've done much of this work before?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Mr. Creasy, I wanted to make sure you have everything you need.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Is the food alright? Maria tells me that you didn't eat.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: The food's fine. Sometimes I don't eat.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: It insults Maria. Slip it to the dog if you have to... Do you mind if I talk to you for a moment?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: How are you getting along with Pinta?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: We'll be okay once she realizes I'm not a new toy.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Yes, she told me. Do you have children, Mr. Creasy?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You should know they're tenacious when they want something. And Pinta wants to be friends.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: You're paying me to protect her, not amuse her. Right?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Look. Maybe this isn't going to work. Maybe you should ask your husband to hire someone... more sociable.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: No, you're right. You were hired to protect her, that's enough. I'm confident you'll do that.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: It makes it all seem so serious.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: It is serious, Mrs. Ramos.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Please, it's Lisa... I'll be coming with you tomorrow. I have lunch with friends.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: The traffic takes some getting used to.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Jordan!

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: If something happened, my reaction would be to fight to protect her. I have skills in that respect. Pinta would benefit by the fact that... I'm a soldier.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Why are you here? Why didn't you die?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Because...  I was already dead.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: They planned it, Samuel and Kalfus.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Planned what?

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: An autosequestra. Kalfus arranged for Pinta to be taken to a safehouse. I'm sure he thought she'd sit there for three days eating pizza and watching TV. It didn't work out that way. Everything got fucked up when I killed the cops and Tazinari saw an opportunity.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: I want you to get into your car now and meet me on the south end of the footbridge between Reforma and the freeway junction. In 45 minutes.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You're lying. I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Then don't come.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Creasy... Wait.

turns.speaker: CREASY
turns.text: Stay here. If you do something stupid, we won't get her back.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: Rosanna Guerrero.

turns.speaker: CREASY'S VOICE
turns.text: It's Creasy.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: CREASY'S VOICE
turns.text: Los Arcos. Was a little girl kidnapped recently? About twelve maybe?

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: Last night. Do you know something?

turns.speaker: CREASY'S VOICE
turns.text: What was her name?

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: Camila. Camila Valencias.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: The family paid the ransom and he was returned two days later.  His father still hasn't gotten up the nerve to ask him if they fucked him up the ass.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: And now every mother with money in Mexico City wants bigger and better bodyguards. My own wife included.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: If she pisses you off, you get another one.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Do you know what she told me last night?

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Of course I care about Pinta. She'll be as beautiful as her mother one day.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Yeah? And if she was ugly?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: All my clients have kidnap and ransom insurance.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: I have a policy, AIG. It covers me and my family and when it runs out in sixty days, without a bodyguard, I will not be able to renew it.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I know you need to please Lisa. An ass like that is hard to find. Good bodyguards are even harder.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: I know! I just had to let one go because I couldn't afford him!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You need a bodyguard of some description. It's a dangerous world we live in. But you will get what you pay for. He doesn't need to be Superman, does he? Can you go fifteen grand?

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: For a year?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: For a few months. Hire someone cheap. You have to have a bodyguard to keep the insurance. Then fire him for incompetence. The important thing is Lisa's daughter will return to school.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: And Lisa will be able to save face. We won't be the only family without a bodyguard.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Her beauty fucks with your mind.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: For an American she understands this country very well.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: She understands men.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: [You have the money.]

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: [Yes.]

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: [OK, repeat the drop instructions.]

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: [The money, 10 million U.S. will be divided into two 15 gallon black canvas bags each containing five million which will be checked at the bank by the K&R agent. Then driven to the house in an armored car where it will be transferred to the delivery car.]

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: [The car will not be powerful and have no trunk.]

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: [I need a driver to drive Samuel, the father.]

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: [No. Why?]

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: [He has a heart condition. Angina. He responds badly to stress.]

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: [OK. You will arrive at Columbus Circle and Reforma Avenue at 3AM. You will drive around the square two times. Samuel will remove his shirt and hold it out the window to I.D. the car.]

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You should be sleeping, baby.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I'm trying, mom.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Good news. You're going back to school.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Samuel is going to hire a new bodyguard. It may take a few days, but you're going back.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Could he speak English? Emilio couldn't speak English.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: We'll see. And thank your father in the morning. A man always needs to be thanked.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Yes, mom?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: This is Mr. Creasy.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I like him, Mom.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: He's like a great big bear.  'Creasy bear'...

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: I think he's been sick. He's alright now, but I think he's been very, very sick.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Well, think about going to sleep. Good night, baby.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: Bye, Mom.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Don't forget your towel.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I'll call you from Detroit, baby.

turns.speaker: PINTA
turns.text: You're going to miss Mexican Halloween. The Day of the Dead.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: A man's worth can be judged by what he has or what he owes. Only the amount matters.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: And bankruptcy. Where will that put me in the social strata?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I'm only asking for one thing. And it's not an extravagance. It's not even for me; it's for our daughter.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Our daughter.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Our child's safety is at stake.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: These people are professionals. They don't waste their time taking children whose fathers are virtually bankrupt.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Samuel, it is not something we should skimp on. A bodyguard's presence in the car or outside the school was at least some form of deterrent. Now he's gone, I feel totally exposed.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: My wife, Mr. Creasy.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Lisa Martin Ramos, Mr. Creasy.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: He has experience in related work. A great deal of it.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Do you have any family, Mr. Creasy?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: I think it's nice he's American.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: I think it's fantastic.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You realize that you've brought a killer into the house.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: She likes him.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Hmm?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Creasy. Pinta likes him.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Pinta loves school. She'd like Count Dracula is he took her back there.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: He has to go, Samuel.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: What? Who?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Creasy.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: Why? You were so pleased with him.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Pinta likes him too much.  She thinks of him as a father.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: It's not.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: I've just been so busy, Lisa.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: He has to go.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: It will be a hard break.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: She's young. She'll get over it.

turns.speaker: SAMUEL
turns.text: I wasn't thinking of Pinta.

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: [A bodyguard was shot trying to protect a 9 year old. The bodyguard's American. Not only that he's black.]

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: [Is that good or bad?]

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: [That's good. Really good. He shot and killed two judicial cops and a kidnapper died in the attack. They're saying he's responsible.]

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: [He'll die of his wounds; bleed to death before he can do anything.]

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: [He sounded strong to me. Stronger than we are.]

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: [Because he's outside. Because he's not tied to the same system we are.]

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: [We did voice analysis of the last five high profile kidnappings, including the little girl. The same man 'The Dreamer'. Listen to this.]

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: [I know this. Your point?]

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: [Creasy is not a policeman. My sense is he could be very valuable to us.]

turns.speaker: ROSANNA
turns.text: [Then what do you have to lose?]

turns.speaker: MANZANO
turns.text: [It's a moral issue. On one hand you're cleaning up the bad guys, but in another way we are feeding the problem that produces bad guys.]
